title: Extensions search bar is emptied when reloading window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Issue Type: Bug 1. Open Extensions in Side Bar 2. Type something in search bar (e.g. `@installed javascript`) 3. Reload window (F1+`reload window`+Enter) 4. Extensions search bar is now empty. It would be helpful if the search bar in the Extensions Side Bar maintained its value when reloading the window. Frequently when I don't know which extension is causing adverse behavior, I make a guess at which extensions it might be (e.g. `@installed css`), disable one, click Reload, check whether it worked or not, and repeat. I find it frustrating that I have to type `@installed css` each time. title: Support multiple lineComments in a language config to allow "Remove Line Comment" to work more reliably
Way to Re-enter Context of the Placeholder Tab Progression While Using Snippets
body: When going through tab progression of a long snippet with many different placeholder values to enter, it can be possible to accidentally click a mouse or hit a wrong key that exits from the snippet context altogether. In ST3, if you hit ctr+z, you are taken back within the context of the snippet's tab progression to the place where it was when the last edit was made, and you can then finish the snippet. I think it would be nice if this were the same in VS Code. I don't know how common it is, but I have some very long and complex snippets, and I'm worried about sometimes needing to restart one half way through if I switch from ST3 to VS Code.

title: Joining with multiple cursors on contiguous lines doesn't work as expected
body:
Issue Type: Bug Select several rows of text, convert selection into multiple lines (ctrl+shift-L on my machine). Join the lines (ctrl+J on my machine). I expect the lines to be collapsed into a single line, with the mutltipe cursors positioned throughout the lline at the end of what was formerly the end of each line. What happens in VS Code is you end up with half the lines joining, and some bits becoming selected and some not. I can see no rhyme or reason to the selection. If you press ctrl+j again to try to further join the lines, you get an error message. This works as expected in Sublime Text; try it there if you have that handy. title: Consider improving the allow/disallow automatic task actions

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
With https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/64613 we introduced simple allow/disallow actions that mimic what we do for terminal shell configuration. This approach as several disadvantages:
- the actions show up on empty windows (no open folder)
- it's unclear what the current state is
- user doesn't see the tasks that are (supposed to be) running automatically

A more sophisticated QuickPick based UI could provide the user with this information.

title: Commenting widget wraps text
body: Issue Type: Bug See picture. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4674940/49663044-4a67df00-fa02-11e8-8702-c39c58b51125.png) VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.30.0-insider (a152a5c7818a13666a5879b4450eb26a4d45fbde, 2018-12-07T10:25:53.709Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.0.0

title: automatically place a semicolon after writing a parenthesis instead of inside
body:
When typing an open parenthesis followed by a semicolon to close the line, it actually types "(;)"

Isnt it better in terms of productivity to automatically place the semicolon after the parenthesis like "();" ? it avoids the user to have to press the right key to move the cursor out of the parenthesis

title: Debugging method chains

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Given this code:

``` ts
a()
  .b()
  .c()
```

When I place an inline breakpoint before the `c` method is called, I want to see the resulting value from the method chain calls so far (`a().b()`).

Could this be added to the debugger? Given an inline breakpoint just prior to a method call, perhaps the debugger could show the method's parent object under the "Variables" section.

title: Using OS user name / git user name inside code snippets
Interactive Diagnostics
body:
## Problem
JS and TS diagnostic messages can get quite large, especially when dealing with frameworks like Vue or react.   The TS team has worked to significantly improve and shorten diagnostic messages, including replacing complex type information with `...`, however there are still cases where you need to see the full type information. Right now, we have to staticly choose to expand the additional information or not. They would like the user to be able to interactively expand types within a diagnostic

In addition, the overall diagnostic experience could be improved. Two areas identified talking with the TS team:

* Syntax coloring of inline code in diagnostics
* Go to definition in diagnostics

## Refs
#11847

## Desired User Experience
Consider a diagnostic message  `T<...>`. We would like the `...` to be something like a  link. Clicking it would expand the diagnostic message to `T<Array<...>>`, which itself contains another expandable link

## Requirements
The main focus is on being able dynamically to expand sections of a diagnostic. We need new VS Code API support for this and then will need languages to adopt this API. However, I think the other two features should be considered while designing the new diagnostics API as they are likely something we would like to support and will influence overall api design 

For expansion, we want to be able to:

- Mark arbitrary spans within a diagnostics as expandable
- Lazily compute these expansions, i.e. don't resolve the expansions ahead of time
- Allow expansions to contain other expansions
- Show a progress indicator of some kind while an expansion is being resolved

Many of these features also make sense for quick info hovers

title: F4 conflict between text search and references list
body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/64227.

Here is my scenario:
1) search for references
2) <kbd>F4</kbd> to jump to a particular reference
3) selected some text in the editor and <kbd>Cmd</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>F</kbd>
4) <kbd>F4</kbd>
=> we jump to the next reference but I'd expect it to jump to the next search result as the search result view has focus

![screen shot 2018-12-04 at 10 16 23 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4674940/49463612-bc93b600-f7ad-11e8-91d1-de64f15702fc.png)

title: Highlight file containing definition
body:
There is already `Go to Definition` in vscode, so that's usually not the file you're looking for.

Maybe it should also work with [Expanding folder options](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-references-view/issues/28) - When file has 1 reference and that reference is the definition - file shouldn't auto expand.

title: [Suggestion] Add option for displaying in panel
body: Search has this option (`search.location`). It would be great if this view could also be shown in the panel.

title: Support nls
body: This extension should be localised for other languages

title: References list should react on file changes
body:
References list view does not react to file changes. Which makes me easy to see outdated results. This is particuarly noticable when I use the references list as a todo list and I am going one by one and changing stuff. I can easily make the mistake and think I did not change something when I actualy did.

The other downside of this is that we are not consistent with the search view which nicely reacts on file changes and updates.

title: List references: removing items feels lagy and shows progress
body:
1. List all references
2. Click on the x button in the viewlet
3. Notice that removing items is very laggy and it even shows a tiny bit of a progress bar

I guess this is because we are refreshing the whole tree.
Optimally we would be able to refresh just one item. Or we could control if we should show progress
The gif did not capture the progress bar but it is visible on my machine and looks like a screen glitch.

![lag](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/48125842-f392ac80-e27f-11e8-8269-12de2bf204a7.gif)

title: Feature Reqeust: Also show line numbers
body:
Also Show line numbers like 
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/v1_29.md#show-line-numbers-in-search

title: Clear results from a file that is deleted
body:
**steps**
1. List references for a symbol used in multiple files
1. Delete one of the referenced file using the VS Code explorer

**Bug**
Results for the file remain in the search results. The VS Code search view clears results of files that are deleted

title: "Auto Find In Selection" breaks "Find Next Selection"
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.29.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro, 64 bit, Version 10.0.17134 Build 17134

Enabling **"Auto Find In Selection"** will make **"Find Next Selection"** useless, as it will only search in the selected text. I would like to be able to select a word and invoke "Find Next Selection" to jump to the next occurence without having to disable "Auto Find In Selection".

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set **editor.find.autoFindInSelection** to **true**
2. Select a word.
3. Invoke **"Find Next Selection"**

I expect it to jump to the next occurence.
But due to "Auto Find In Selection" the cursor will stay where it is.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Need a better grammar support for Rust lang
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

This problem is raised up for several times before (#49932, #45628) But not resolved. VSCode team member replies to these issues as: We are using the same grammar with Atom. In fact, Atom has already changed to [tree-sitter syntax](https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter-rust) as the bundled Rust language grammar support package (https://github.com/atom/atom/tree/master/packages/language-rust-bundled).

However, Vscode's bundled rust support extension is based on Zargony's [package](https://github.com/zargony/atom-language-rust) which is not updated for nearly a year and many issues open with no reply at all.

Currently every highlighting problem in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/49932 still happens and that's not simply a "theme" thing as @mjbvz mentioned in the orignal issue, I think.

In the original issue, @mjbvz  also declares that 
> Since we use the same grammar, I believe this is just a matter of theming. As far as I can tell, the atom rust extension injects its own themeing rules to provide better colors.

the plugin he referred to is not even Zargony's package. it's a package from @miqh, who also ported the atom package to vscode, and fails to correctly provide grammar for Rust as well.

Hope that I get everything right, thanks for any help.
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

title: [feature request] - Problems Tab not readable
body:
v1.29.1

I have analyzed the Problems bar and I'm missing some features:

1) To be able to filter by projects - (multi-project workspace - some of them might be unrelated and the list can be very long) - however, I see that I can filter by project folder
2) Filter by Warnings / Error / TODO message - for the last one I'm using a separate TODO tree plugin
If the TODO would be highlighted also, it won't be necessary to use any external plugin.
3) Problems should be arranged in a tree-like system (showing folders) - or similar what the Todo  Tree plugin is doing (switch between a flat and a hierarchical tree with a button at the top). I had 1500 warnings in my workspace and simply it was too much to read next to the errors and TODO-s, and missed the benefit of the whole Problem tab.
The tree-like system can be filterable.

I have no idea how to type in "info" in a relation of a folder or project. It's not a regex field.

Can you make a PR on these suggestion pls, as it's not that usable at the moment?

title: The windows has crashed when copy large file content
body:
Information:
- Version: 1.30.0-insider (user setup)
- Commit: 85f805acf9436381b878cab5ab6c5146beec7893
- Date: 2018-12-05T06:19:36.555Z
- Electron: 2.0.12
- Chrome: 61.0.3163.100
- Node.js: 8.9.3
- V8: 6.1.534.41
- OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a large sql database dump (my dump has 78.861.290 bytes, not too big)
2. I tried to copy 75.841.605 characters using right click dialog (also occurs with ctrl-v)
3. A message says "The windows has crashed" (no content is in the clipboard)

If i open the file with notepad, i can copy all the content of the file to the clipboard.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Minimap: click and drag
body:
**Feature request:** click a spot on the minimap that's not currently visible in the editor, then drag the minimap up or down.

**Expected behavior:** the minimal selection rectangle thingy should move with your cursor.

**Actual behavior:** the thing does not move, unless you let go and re-click and hold, at which point it finally starts dragging.

Previous issues:

- #21708, closed because if the minimap is taller than your viewport, the minimap widget thingy doesn't move to where your mouse is; however this feature could still be possible when the minimap fully fits in the viewport without clipping
- #59582, closed as a duplicate of #24395 but that mentions three features which don't include this
- #22540, closed as a duplicate of #21708 but see above

title: Option for setting "editor.renderLineHighlight" and possibly "editor.renderColumnHighlight" to "background"
body:
It would be nice to be able to set the current line's background to something solid. The current style is a bit hard to spot for me.
I know there are themes that do this but I think having this option regardless of a theme's opinion is better.

Also a setting for the active column would be great. Here is an example:
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9828983/49544980-fc10ee00-f8e4-11e8-8370-3929ff8baa53.png)

title: Support for full file path in "when" clause
body:
I can currently use the filename of a file in a when clause by using `resourceFilename`. But I would like to offer a editor context menu item only for js files under a certain path, I took a look through the [when clauses](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/keybindings#_when-clause-contexts) and nothing appears to offer this functionality right now.

Example:

I would like to only add to the editor context menu for files under the `app/controllers` directory.

```json
{
	"command": "myExtension.openRelatedFile",
	"when": "editorLangId == javascript && resourceFilePath =~ /app\/controllers/"
}
```

Is this something that's currently possible and I'm just missing something 🙂? I tried searching existing issues/SO and found nothing

title: Extension Pack: Uninstall dependencies from pack if they are removed in an update

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Hi there, we've been running an extension pack [for Artsy](https://github.com/artsy/vscode-artsy) for a few months now and it's been great. 

We've had a bit of churn in our extensions, and hoped that vscode might be able to handle the uninstallation of dependent extensions when we remove a value form the `extensionPack` keys

e.g.: Between v1 and v2

```diff
    "extensionPack": [ 
        "Orta.vscode-danger",
-        "misogi.ruby-rubocop", 
-        "rebornix.ruby", 
        "mjmcloug.vscode-elixir", 
```

VS Code would know that `misogi.ruby-rubocop` and `rebornix.ruby` were installed via this pack (and not a user install) and thus offer (or automatically) remove them from the local setup.

title: Creating a new file while sidebar is hidden could be improved

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: ![gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35271042/49519667-cbf42b80-f8a1-11e8-8ce1-6c31712ef4f9.gif) Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open file 2. Hide sidebar (Cmd+B) 3. Command Palette > New file 4. Sidebar appears with new file added next to the current file It would be great if running `File: New File` from the command palette would show you a picker with the path pre-populated, allowing you to traverse through folder and also preserving the users' view. Here's a quick mockup: cc @stevencl

title: Git: Gracefully handle git hooks

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Most projects will have some form of precommit hooks for linting or tests through libraries such as [lint-staged](https://github.com/okonet/lint-staged) and [husky](https://github.com/typicode/husky).

When committing via the source control panel in VSCode there's no visual indicator for when a git hook is running. I think this could be an opportunity to put some UI indicator around this.
